summary: Build a simple Sports Shop web app featuring a product list, product details, cart functionality (count + cart page), and a basic checkout flow.

existing_features.title: Create a Sports Shop home page that displays a list of products with an "Add" button for each product.
Display a cart item count in the header that updates as items are added to the cart.
Seed the product list with these products: Cricket Bat, Football, Running Shoes, Tennis Racket, Sports Jersey.
Apply a coherent, consistent visual theme for the Sports Shop UI (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) across header and product list screens.
Generate and include basic static images as frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI.
Add a product details view/page that can be opened from the product list for a specific product, showing that product’s name, image, price, and full description.

Allow adding the currently viewed product to the cart from the product details view, and ensure the cart count in the header updates consistently across both the product list and product details views.
Handle invalid or missing product selection gracefully when opening the product details view (e.g., show a simple “Product not found” message with a way to return to the product list).
Ensure each product’s name is clearly displayed in all existing product presentation areas, including the product list cards and the product details view, using English user-facing text.
Update the shop branding text so the app displays the shop name as "Vikash Sports" anywhere the shop/site title is shown (including the header title and the browser tab/page title).
Add a dedicated Cart page/view that can be opened from the header and shows the current cart contents.
Support basic cart item management actions on the Cart page/view and keep the header cart count consistent across all views.
Add a Checkout view that can be reached from the Cart page via an enabled “Proceed to Checkout” button when the cart is not empty.
Implement a Checkout form that collects basic customer and shipping details using English user-facing labels and provides a clear order summary.
Connect the Checkout view to the backend order placement API and show an Order Confirmation view after a successful order.
Handle checkout edge cases gracefully (empty cart, backend errors) with clear English messages.

Add an Order Details view/page that can be opened from the Order History view for a specific order, and display the order’s ID, date/time, item list (name, price, quantity, line totals), subtotal/total, customer/shipping details, and selected payment method using clear English user-facing text.

Add payment options to the Checkout view by allowing the user to select a payment method before placing the order, validate that a payment method is selected, and include the selected payment method in the order success flow and any order summaries/receipts shown in the UI.

Wire the Checkout flow to use the backend order placement API (instead of generating a mock order ID), and update the frontend order history source of truth to load orders from the backend so Order History and Order Details remain available after navigation/refresh.

Extend the seeded product catalog to include additional product options: Jacket, Half Pant, Full Pant, and Football T-Shirt (English names), so these products appear on the home page product grid and can be opened in the product details view and added to the cart like existing products.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a simple Sports Shop app with product list, add-to-cart, and cart item count display
Add product details view/page for each product (navigate from product list and show product information)
Ensure the product name is displayed in the UI (e.g., on product cards and/or any relevant product display areas)
Add a dedicated cart page/view (navigate from header and display cart contents)
Add a basic checkout flow (proceed to checkout from cart and place order)
Add backend order placement so the Checkout view can place an order and receive an order identifier.
Add an Order History page so users can view past orders after checkout.
Add an Order Details page/view (view details of a specific order after checkout)
Add payment options during checkout (allow selecting a payment method and include it in the order flow)

Implement backend order APIs in the single Motoko actor to support creating and retrieving orders, including persisting the selected payment method and customer/shipping details as part of the order record.
Add product picture options (allow selecting/setting product images for products in the catalog/UI)
Add more products to the home page/catalog (e.g., Jacket, Half Pant, Full Pant, Football, T-Shirt) as additional product options.
